For example, Kumamon is a representative yurukyara of Kumamoto Prefecture and is responsible for promoting tourism and local agricultural products. Many yurukyara designs are cute and friendly. They also incorporate regional characteristics, so you can sometimes tell which region they represent just by looking at the character. For example, Funassyi represents Funabashi City in Chiba Prefecture and is designed with a pear motif. Yurukyara are not only active in events and campaigns, but are also popular on social networking services and TV programs. This has the effect of raising the profile of the region and increasing the number of tourists. On the other hand, Yurukyara are costly to maintain, and there is a large difference between successful and unsuccessful characters. Yurukyara are a uniquely Japanese culture. When you travel to Japan, be sure to look for local yurukyara. You will especially enjoy them as souvenirs and photo spots.

japanese: 禅宗は日本の仏教の一派であり、特に「座禅」を中心とした修行方法で知られています。禅の起源は中国の禅宗にさかのぼり、日本には鎌倉時代に伝わりました。その後、臨済宗と曹洞宗が日本で広まり、それぞれ独自の特徴を持ちながら、今日に至るまで多くの人々に影響を与えています。禅の教えは、形式や理論を重視するのではなく、直接的な体験を通じて悟りを得ることを目的としています。例えば、「公案」と呼ばれる問いを通して、思考の枠を超えた直感的な理解を促す方法が有名です。また、日常生活の中に修行を取り入れることも重要とされ、「一日作さざれば一日食らわず」という言葉に象徴されるように、労働や日常の行いそのものが修行とみなされます。禅の精神は日本文化にも深く影響を与えました。茶道、庭園、書道などの伝統文化には、禅のシンプルさや自然との調和を重視する考え方が色濃く反映されています。そのため、禅は単なる宗教的な教義にとどまらず、日本人の美意識や価値観の形成にも寄与してきたと言えるでしょう。現代においても、禅の哲学は多くの人々に支持されています。ストレス社会と呼ばれる現代において、座禅による心の平穏を求める人々が増えており、世界中で禅が注目されています。このように、禅は古代から現代まで一貫して人々に深い洞察と安らぎを提供してきたのです。
english: Zen Buddhism is a branch of Japanese Buddhism, particularly known for its practice centered on zazen (seated meditation). The origins of Zen can be traced back to the Zen sect in China, which was introduced to Japan in the Kamakura period (1185-1333). Subsequently, the Rinzai and Soto sects spread in Japan, each with its own unique characteristics, influencing many people to this day. Zen teachings do not emphasize formality or theory, but rather aim to attain enlightenment through direct experience. For example, it is famous for its method of encouraging intuitive understanding beyond the boundaries of thought through questions called koans. It is also important to incorporate training into daily life, and as symbolized by the phrase If you don't work for a day, you won't eat for a day, labor and daily activities themselves are considered training. The spirit of Zen has deeply influenced Japanese culture. Traditional cultures such as the tea ceremony, gardens, and calligraphy strongly reflect Zen's emphasis on simplicity and harmony with nature. Thus, Zen is more than just a religious doctrine; it has also contributed to the formation of the Japanese sense of beauty and values. Even today, the philosophy of Zen is supported by many people. In today's stressful society, Zen is attracting attention around the world as more and more people seek the peace of mind that comes from sitting in meditation. In this way, Zen has consistently provided people with deep insight and peace of mind from ancient times to the present.

japanese: 札幌は北海道の大きな都市です。日本の北にあります。札幌は冬がとても寒いですが、スキーやスノーボードをする人に人気があります。毎年二月に「雪まつり」が行われます。この祭りでは、大きな雪や氷の彫刻を見ることができます。夏も札幌は楽しい場所です。公園で花を見たり、美味しい食べ物を食べたりすることができます。有名な料理は「ジンギスカン」と「札幌ラーメン」です。観光客も地元の人もよく食べます。札幌には時計台やテレビ塔のような観光地もあります。自然と都会が一緒に楽しめる素敵な場所です。
english: Sapporo is a large city in Hokkaido, Japan. It is located in the north of Japan. Sapporo is popular among skiers and snowboarders, although winters are very cold. The Sapporo Snow Festival is held every year in February. At this festival, visitors can see large snow and ice sculptures. Sapporo is also a fun place to visit in the summer. Visitors can see flowers in the parks and enjoy delicious food. Famous dishes are “Genghis Khan” and “Sapporo Ramen”. Both tourists and locals eat them often. Sapporo also has tourist attractions such as the Clock Tower and the TV Tower. It is a wonderful place where nature and the city can be enjoyed together.

japanese: さつきとめいという二人の姉妹が田舎に引っ越すことになった。父親と一緒に古い家に住むことになり、母親は病気で近くの病院に入院している。姉妹は新しい家やその周りの自然を探検しながら、少しずつ田舎の生活に慣れていく。ある日、めいは庭で遊んでいると、小さな不思議な生き物を見つけて追いかける。気づけば森の奥深くまで来ていて、大きな木の下で大きなトトロという生き物に出会う。めいはトトロとすぐに仲良くなり、彼に「トトロ」と名前をつける。トトロは優しくてちょっと変わった存在だが、とても安心感を与えてくれる。後日、さつきもトトロと出会い、二人はますますトトロに魅了される。雨の日、さつきとめいがバス停で父親を待っていると、トトロが現れる。トトロは葉っぱの傘を持っていて、雨に濡れることも気にしない様子だ。トトロはバスの代わりに巨大な「ネコバス」を呼び出し、それに乗ってどこかへ行く。母親の病状がなかなか良くならないことに心配しためいは、一人で病院まで行こうとするが、途中で迷子になってしまう。村の人たちやさつきが一生懸命めいを探すが見つからない。さつきはトトロに助けを求めると、トトロはネコバスを呼び出し、さつきを乗せてめいのいる場所へと急ぐ。最終的に、さつきとめいは無事に再会し、母親にも良い知らせが届く。トトロたちの助けに感謝しつつ、姉妹は再び穏やかな日常を取り戻す。トトロとその仲間たちは、森の奥で静かに見守り続ける。
english: Two sisters, Satsuki and Mei, are moving to the countryside. They will live in an old house with their father, and their mother is ill and in a nearby hospital. The sisters gradually get used to life in the countryside as they explore their new home and the nature around it. One day, while playing in the garden, Mei finds a small mysterious creature and chases after it. She finds herself deep in the forest, and under a large tree, she meets a large Totoro. Mei quickly becomes friends with him and names him “Totoro." Totoro is kind and a little strange, but he makes her feel very safe. Later, Satsuki also meets Totoro, and the two become more and more fascinated by him. On a rainy day, Satsuki and Mei are waiting for their father at the bus stop when Totoro appears. Totoro has a leaf umbrella and does not seem to mind getting wet. Instead of a bus, Totoro calls a giant “cat bus” and rides it somewhere. Mei, worried that her mother's condition is not getting better, tries to go to the hospital alone, but gets lost on the way. The villagers and Satsuki do their best to find her, but they cannot find her. Satsuki asks Totoro for help, and Totoro calls the cat bus, which carries Satsuki and rushes to where Mei is. In the end, Satsuki and Mei are safely reunited, and their mother receives good news. Grateful for the help of Totoro and his friends, the sisters once again return to their peaceful lives. Totoro and his friends continue to quietly watch over them deep in the forest.

japanese: キキは13歳の魔女見習いの女の子。魔女の伝統に従って、修行のために一人で新しい街に移ることにした。黒猫のジジと一緒に空を飛びながら、海辺の街に到着したキキは、初めての大人の生活に胸を躍らせた。しかし、新しい街ではなかなか歓迎されず、キキは自分の居場所を見つけるのに苦労する。そんな中、パン屋の優しい奥さん、おソノさんに出会い、店の一部を借りて住むことができた。キキはほうきで空を飛べる自分の能力を活かして、宅配便の仕事を始める。最初の配達はなかなか上手くいかなかったが、少しずつ経験を積むことで、キキは自信を持ち始める。そして、配達を通じて様々な人々と出会い、彼らとの交流の中で成長していく。友達になったトンボという少年は特にキキにとって大切な存在となるが、彼との関係でも戸惑いやすれ違いが起きる。やがて、キキは魔法の力を失いそうになる。自信をなくし、自分が何もできないように感じてしまうが、ジジや新しい友達たちの支えで、自分自身を見つめ直す。そして、大きな危機が訪れたとき、キキは自分の力を信じ、勇気を出して人々を助ける決心をする。キキは、自分の力や存在意義を改めて感じながら、少しずつ大人としての一歩を踏み出していく。空に向かってほうきで飛ぶキキの姿は、希望と新しい未来を象徴しているかのようだった。
english: Kiki is a 13-year-old apprentice witch. Following witch tradition, she decided to move to a new town by herself to train. Arriving in the seaside town, flying through the air with her black cat, Gigi, Kiki is excited about her first adult life. However, she is not very welcome in her new town, and Kiki struggles to find her place in the world. Then she meets Mrs. Osono, the kind wife of a baker, and is able to rent a part of her store to live in. Kiki takes advantage of her ability to fly on a broomstick and starts working as a courier. Her first deliveries do not go well, but as she gains experience little by little, Kiki begins to gain confidence. Through her deliveries, she meets various people and grows through her interactions with them. A boy named Dragonfly, who becomes her friend, becomes especially important to Kiki, but she is confused and has differences with him as well. Eventually, Kiki almost loses her magical powers. She loses her self-confidence and feels as if she is incapable of doing anything, but with the support of Gigi and her new friends, she begins to look at herself in a new light. When a great crisis arises, Kiki believes in her own power and decides to be brave and help people. Kiki gradually takes a step forward as an adult, with a renewed sense of her own power and the meaning of her existence. The image of Kiki flying on a broomstick toward the sky seemed to symbolize hope and a new future.

japanese: ポニョという小さな魚の女の子は、深い海の中で父親と一緒に暮らしていました。ある日、彼女は海から抜け出し、人間の世界を見たいと思い、泳ぎ始めます。海辺の町に着いたポニョは、崖の上で遊んでいた少年、宗介に出会います。宗介は彼女を瓶の中から助け出し、優しく「ポニョ」と名付けました。ポニョは宗介のことが大好きになり、人間になりたいと強く願います。しかし、ポニョが海を離れたことで、海のバランスが崩れ、大きな嵐が町を襲います。ポニョは父親に連れ戻されますが、どうしても宗介のもとへ戻りたい気持ちは変わりません。彼女の魔法を使い、ついに人間の姿に変わります。嵐の後、宗介とポニョは小さな船に乗り込み、町や家族を探しに行きます。その旅の中で二人はお互いを支え合い、深い絆を築いていきます。最終的に、ポニョが人間として生きるためには宗介の愛が必要だと分かります。宗介はポニョを心から受け入れることを誓い、彼女の願いは叶えられます。海も静かになり、町は元通りになります。ポニョと宗介は、笑顔で新しい毎日を迎える準備を始めました。
english: A little fish girl named Ponyo lived with her father in the deep sea. One day, she decides she wants to get out of the sea and see the human world, so she starts swimming. When Ponyo arrives in a seaside town, she meets a boy named Sosuke who is playing on a cliff. Sosuke rescued her from a bottle and gently named her “Ponyo. Ponyo grew fond of Sosuke and strongly wished to become human. However, when Ponyo leaves the sea, the balance of the sea is upset and a big storm hits the town. Ponyo is taken back to her father, but her desire to return to Sosuke remains unchanged. Using her magic, she finally transforms into human form. After the storm, Sosuke and Ponyo board a small boat and go in search of the town and their families. During their journey, they support each other and form a deep bond. In the end, Ponyo realizes that she needs Sosuke's love in order to live as a human being. Sosuke vows to accept Ponyo with all his heart, and her wish is granted. The sea becomes quiet and the town returns to normal. Ponyo and Sosuke begin to prepare for each new day with smiles on their faces.

japanese: 日本のビールは世界中で人気があり、多くの外国人にも愛されています。特に有名なブランドには、アサヒ、キリン、サッポロ、エビスなどがあります。日本のビールは、その質の高さと独特の味で知られています。多くの日本人は、仕事の後や友人との集まりでビールを飲むのが好きです。ビールは日本の居酒屋文化でも重要な役割を果たしています。「生ビール」という言葉は、居酒屋でよく聞かれます。生ビールは新鮮で、特に暑い夏の日には最高です。また、日本では四季に合わせた季節限定のビールも販売されています。例えば、春には桜をテーマにしたビールが人気です。最近では、クラフトビールも注目されています。地元の小さな醸造所で作られるクラフトビールは、多種多様なフレーバーがあり、個性的な味わいを楽しむことができます。日本のビール文化は、伝統を守りながらも新しい挑戦を続けています。ビールを飲む際は、適量を守り、楽しい時間を過ごすことが大切です。
english: Japanese beer is popular all over the world and loved by many foreigners. Particularly well-known brands include Asahi, Kirin, Sapporo, and Ebisu. Japanese beer is known for its high quality and unique taste. Many Japanese like to drink beer after work or at gatherings with friends. Beer also plays an important role in Japanese izakaya culture. The term “draft beer” is often heard in izakayas. Draft beer is fresh and especially great on a hot summer day. Seasonal beers are also available in Japan to match the four seasons. For example, cherry blossom-themed beers are popular in the spring. Recently, craft beer has also been attracting attention. Craft beers made by small local breweries come in a wide variety of flavors and offer unique tastes. The Japanese beer culture continues to take on new challenges while preserving its traditions. When drinking beer, it is important to observe the proper amount and have a good time.

japanese: 空から落ちてきた少女、シータは、不思議な力を持つ首飾りをしていた。彼女は鉱山の町に住む少年、パズーに助けられる。パズーは彼女がどこから来たのか気になり、話を聞くうちに、彼女が「ラピュタ」と呼ばれる伝説の浮かぶ島に関わりがあることを知る。二人はシータを追いかける軍隊と空賊から逃げることになる。空賊のリーダー、ドーラは最初は敵だったが、彼女の心強さと面白い性格から、次第に二人と協力するようになる。彼らはラピュタを見つけるため、空の旅に出る。道中、シータの秘密が明らかになる。彼女はラピュタの王家の末裔で、首飾りはラピュタの力を制御するカギだった。その力を狙うムスカという冷酷な男が現れ、二人を脅かす。ムスカはラピュタの力を手に入れ、世界を支配しようとしていた。ついにラピュタを発見した一行は、美しいが朽ちた空の城に足を踏み入れる。しかし、ムスカはシータを捕え、ラピュタの秘密を解き明かそうとする。彼の野望を止めるため、シータとパズーは知恵を絞り、最後にはラピュタを守るための古代の呪文を唱える。ラピュタは静かに空高く飛び去り、地上に戻るパズーとシータ。彼らは互いに助け合いながら、新しい未来へ向かって進むのだった。
english: Sita, a young girl who fell from the sky, was wearing a necklace with magical powers. She is rescued by Pazoo, a boy living in a mining town. Pazoo is curious about where she came from, and as he listens to her story, he learns that she is related to a legendary floating island called “Laputa." The two of them must flee from the army and air pirates who are chasing after Sita. Dora, the leader of the air pirates, is initially an enemy, but her reassuring and amusing personality gradually leads her to cooperate with them. They embark on a journey in the sky to find Laputa. Along the way, Sita's secret is revealed. She is a descendant of the royal family of Laputa, and her necklace is the key to controlling Laputa's power. A ruthless man named Musca appears and threatens them both. Musca wants to take Laputa's power and rule the world. When the group finally discovers Laputa, they step into the beautiful but decaying castle in the sky. However, Musca captures Sita and tries to unravel the secret of Laputa. To stop his ambition, Sita and Pazoo gather their wits and finally cast an ancient spell to protect Laputa. Laputa quietly flies away high into the sky, and Pazuzu and Sita return to earth. Helping each other, they continue on toward a new future.

japanese: 堀越二郎は、空を飛ぶことに憧れる少年だった。しかし彼の視力は弱く、パイロットになる夢を諦めなければならなかった。それでも空への情熱は消えず、彼は飛行機を設計する道を選んだ。彼の大学生活は、知識を深める日々だった。数学や物理を学び、飛行機の構造を理解しようと努力した。そして彼はイタリアの天才設計士、カプローニの夢を心の支えにしていた。「夢を持つことは美しいことだ」と、彼の言葉はいつも二郎を励ましていた。時は流れ、二郎は航空会社で働き始めた。彼の才能は徐々に認められ、重要なプロジェクトを任されるようになった。しかし、その時代は戦争の影が色濃く、飛行機は戦争の道具として求められていた。彼は心の中で葛藤しながらも、設計に全力を注いだ。そんな中、彼は菜穂子という女性と出会う。美しく繊細な彼女との恋は、二郎の心に新たな喜びをもたらした。しかし、菜穂子は重い病を抱えており、彼らの未来には困難が待っていた。それでも二人は愛を信じ、共に過ごす時間を大切にした。飛行機を完成させるための挑戦と、愛する人を守りたいという願い。二郎はどちらも諦めることなく、生きる意味を見出そうとした。彼の飛行機はついに完成し、青空を駆け抜けた。その美しい姿は、彼の全ての努力と夢の結晶だった。菜穂子との別れが訪れる日、二郎は静かに空を見上げた。彼の心には、彼女との思い出と、夢を追い続けた日々が刻まれていた。空は変わらず広がり、彼の作った飛行機が未来へと飛び立つのを見守っていた。
english: Jiro Horikoshi was a boy who longed to fly. However, his eyesight was weak and he had to give up his dream of becoming a pilot. Still, his passion for the sky remained, and he chose to design airplanes. His college days were spent deepening his knowledge. He studied mathematics and physics and strove to understand the structure of airplanes. And he was inspired by the dream of Caproni, the Italian genius designer, who said: “It's beautiful to have a dream," and his words always encouraged Jiro. Time passed and Jiro started working for an airline company. His talent was gradually recognized and he was entrusted with important projects. However, the shadow of war was thick in that era, and airplanes were sought after as tools of war. He put all his energy into his designs, despite the conflict in his mind. In the midst of all this, he met a woman named Nahoko. His love for the beautiful and delicate Nahoko brought new joy to Jiro's heart. However, Nahoko was seriously ill, and their future was fraught with difficulties. Still, they both believed in love and cherished the time they spent together. The challenge to complete the plane and the desire to protect the one they love. Jiro never gave up on either and tried to find the meaning of life. His plane was finally completed and flew through the blue sky. Its beautiful appearance was the fruit of all his efforts and dreams. On the day he was to say goodbye to Nahoko, Jiro quietly looked up at the sky. His heart was engraved with memories of her and the days he had spent chasing his dream. The sky remained unchanged and spread out, watching over the plane he had built as it took off into the future.

japanese: ソフィーという名前の少女は、小さな帽子屋で静かな日々を送っていました。彼女は自分の運命に特別な期待を持たず、平凡な生活を続けていました。しかし、ある日、彼女の人生は突然変わります。ソフィーが街を歩いていると、不思議な雰囲気を持つ美しい青年に助けられます。その青年はハウルという魔法使いで、彼の移動する動く城は誰もが恐れる存在でした。ハウルとの出会いはほんの一瞬の出来事でしたが、その夜、ソフィーのもとに荒地の魔女が現れ、彼女を呪いで老婆の姿に変えてしまいます。驚きと混乱の中で、自分の家を離れる決意をしたソフィーは、山々を越えて動く城を見つけます。老婆の姿で動く城に入り込んだソフィーは、ハウルの家族のような奇妙な仲間たちと出会います。火の悪魔カルシファー、若い弟子のマルクル、そしてさまざまな魔法の秘密が彼女を待ち受けていました。ソフィーは、カルシファーとの取引を通じて、呪いを解く手がかりを探し始めます。一方で、ハウルもまた自分の心を奪おうとする暗い力と戦っていました。ハウルは恐ろしい魔法使いと思われていましたが、ソフィーは彼が実は優しく脆い心を持つ人間であることに気づきます。やがて、戦争の影響が二人の運命をさらに複雑にします。ハウルは自分の身を犠牲にしてでも戦争を止めようとしますが、ソフィーは彼を救いたいと願います。彼女は自分の強さを信じ、愛と勇気を持って行動します。物語の最後には、ソフィーの愛がハウルの心を救い、彼女自身の呪いも解かれます。動く城は新しい形に生まれ変わり、ソフィーとハウル、そして仲間たちは新しい希望に満ちた日々を迎えます。
english: A young girl named Sophie lived a quiet life in a small hat shop. She had no special expectations for her destiny and continued to lead an ordinary life. One day, however, her life suddenly changes. While Sophie is walking in the city, she is rescued by a beautiful young man with a mysterious atmosphere. The young man is a wizard named Howl, and his moving castle is feared by everyone. The encounter with Howl was only fleeting, but that night the Witch of the Waste appears to Sophie and changes her into the form of an old woman with a curse. Amazed and confused, Sophie decides to leave her home and finds the moving castle across the mountains. Entering the moving castle in the form of an old woman, Sophie meets a strange group of friends who resemble Howl's family. Calcifer, the fire demon, his young apprentice Markl, and various magical secrets await her. Through her dealings with Calcifer, Sophie begins to search for clues that will break the curse. Meanwhile, Howl is also battling dark forces that want to take his mind. Although Howl is thought to be a fearsome wizard, Sophie discovers that he is actually a gentle and fragile soul. Soon, the effects of war further complicate their fates. Howl tries to stop the war, even at the cost of his own life, but Sophie wishes to save him. She believes in her own strength and acts with love and courage. At the end of the story, Sophie's love saves Howl's heart and breaks her own curse. The moving castle is reborn in a new form, and Sophie, Howl, and their friends welcome new and hopeful days.

japanese: アシタカという若いエミシの戦士が村を襲うタタリ神を倒すところから物語は始まる。しかし、その戦いの代償として彼の腕に呪いが刻まれた。呪いは彼の命を徐々に蝕んでいく。村を去り、呪いを解く方法を探すために旅立つアシタカは、西の地に向かう。旅の途中、アシタカは巨大なイノシシの神や、獣神の森を守る狼たちと出会う。その中に、狼に育てられた少女、サンがいた。サンは人間社会を憎み、森と共に生きる道を選んでいる。アシタカは森と人間の間で対立する彼女の姿に心を動かされる。一方、人間の集落ではエボシ御前が鉄を作るために森を切り開き、森の神々と激しく対立していた。彼女は強い意志を持ち、集落の人々を守るために手段を選ばない。アシタカは森と人間の間で争いを解決し、平和を築く道を模索するが、彼自身もその葛藤に巻き込まれていく。やがて、人間と森の神々の争いはさらに激化する。巨大なシシ神が命と死を司る存在として現れるが、その力が暴走し、森と人間の世界を崩壊させる危険が迫る。アシタカとサンは力を合わせて混乱を収めようとするが、彼らの信念が試される瞬間が訪れる。最終的に、アシタカは呪いを受け入れながらも人間と自然が共存する可能性を信じ続ける。サンは人間と離れ、森での生活を選ぶが、アシタカとの絆は深く残る。それぞれが自分の道を歩み始めることで、物語は静かに幕を閉じる。
english: The story begins with a young emishi warrior named Ashitaka defeating the Tatari gods who attack his village. But the cost of that battle is a curse carved into his arm. The curse gradually consumes his life. Ashitaka leaves the village and sets out on a journey to the west to find a way to break the curse. On his journey, Ashitaka encounters a giant boar god and the wolves that guard the forest of the beast god. Among them is San, a girl raised by wolves. San hates human society and has chosen to live with the forest. Ashitaka is moved by her conflict between the forest and humans. Meanwhile, in the human village, Eboshi Gozen clears the forest to make iron and is in violent conflict with the forest gods. She has a strong will and will stop at nothing to protect the people of the village. Ashitaka seeks a way to resolve the conflict and build peace between the forest and humans, but he himself becomes involved in the conflict. Soon, the conflict between the humans and the forest gods becomes even more intense. A giant Deer God appears as the ruler of life and death, but his power goes out of control and threatens to destroy the world of forests and humans. Ashitaka and San join forces to end the chaos, but a moment arrives that will test their faith. Ultimately, Ashitaka accepts the curse but continues to believe in the possibility of humans and nature coexisting. San chooses to leave the humans and live in the forest, but his bond with Ashitaka remains deep. The story quietly comes to a close as each begins to follow his own path.

japanese: 第二次世界大戦末期、神戸は空襲に見舞われた。その中で、清太と節子の兄妹は母親を失い、焼け野原に取り残される。父親は海軍に従軍中で、二人きりで生き延びる術を探すしかなかった。清太は妹を守ろうと必死で、親戚の家に身を寄せるが、厳しい生活の中で次第に冷たい扱いを受ける。やがて清太は、節子と共に親戚の家を離れ、自力で生きていく決断をする。二人は廃墟となった防空壕を住処にし、周囲の自然から少しでも食料を見つけ出す日々を送った。ホタルが飛び交う夜、節子は小さな命の輝きに目を輝かせるが、同時にその命が短いことも悟る。飢えと病に苦しむ節子を救おうと、清太はなんとか食料を手に入れようと奔走する。しかし戦時下の物資不足と他者の冷淡さが、二人の状況をさらに厳しくした。清太が戻った時には、節子はもう限界を迎えていた。兄の愛情に包まれながらも、彼女は小さな命を燃やし尽くすように静かに息を引き取った。清太は節子を火葬し、その灰を入れた缶を大切に持ち歩くようになる。妹を失った彼の心には、言葉では表せない喪失感が残り、戦争の理不尽さが深く刻まれる。
english: At the end of World War II, Kobe was hit by an air raid. Seita and Setsuko lost their mother and were left behind in the burnt ruins. Their father was serving in the Navy, and they were left alone to find a way to survive. Seita, desperate to protect his sister, takes shelter at a relative's house, but is gradually treated coldly by the harsh living conditions. Eventually, Seita decides to leave the relative's house with Setsuko and live on his own. The two make an abandoned air-raid shelter their home and spend their days finding what little food they can from the surrounding nature. At night when fireflies are flying around, Setsuko's eyes sparkle with the brightness of a tiny life, but she also realizes that her life is short. Seita scrambles to find food to save Setsuko, who is suffering from hunger and illness. However, wartime shortages and the indifference of others made their situation even more difficult. By the time Seita returned, Setsuko had reached her limits. Surrounded by her brother's love, she passed away quietly, as if her little life had been burned away. Seita cremated Setsuko and began to carry the can containing her ashes around with great care. The loss of his sister leaves an indescribable sense of loss in his heart, and the unreasonableness of war is deeply etched into his mind.

titleEnglish: In This Corner of the World
japanese: 第二次世界大戦の時代、広島県の呉市という町に、少女のすずが住んでいました。すずは自然が好きで、空想にふけるのが得意な優しい性格の女の子です。彼女は家族と一緒に静かな日々を送っていましたが、ある日、呉に住む周作という青年から突然の縁談が持ち上がります。周作の家は軍港に近く、戦争の影響を強く受ける場所でした。結婚して周作の家に嫁いだすずは、新しい家族とともに暮らし始めます。家事や畑仕事をこなし、限られた食糧で工夫して料理を作るすずの姿は、戦争中でも生活を大切にしようとする彼女の強さを感じさせます。周作の家族もすずを暖かく迎え入れ、少しずつ絆が深まっていきます。しかし、戦争はますます激しくなり、呉の町も空襲を受けます。すずは家族や近所の人々とともに防空壕に避難しながら、恐怖と不安の日々を過ごします。彼女の努力と明るさは周囲の人々を支えますが、大切な人々を失う悲しみも経験します。そんな中で、すずは戦争という厳しい現実に向き合いながらも、生きる希望を見つけ出そうとします。彼女の絵や想像力は、辛い現実を乗り越える力となり、家族や仲間とともに少しずつ未来を見据えていきます。
english: During the World War II era, a young girl named Suzu lived in a town called Kure in Hiroshima Prefecture. Suzu is a kind natured girl who loves nature and is good at daydreaming. She lived a quiet life with her family until one day, a young man named Shusaku, who lived in Kure, suddenly offered her a marriage proposal. Shusaku's house was near a military port and was strongly affected by the war. Suzu married into Shusaku's family and started living with her new family. Suzu's housework, farm work, and creative cooking with the limited food available are all indicative of her strength to cherish her life even in the midst of war. Shusaku's family also warmly welcomes Suzu, and the bond between them gradually deepens. However, the war becomes more and more intense, and the town of Kure is hit by air raids. Suzu spends her days in fear and anxiety as she takes refuge in an air-raid shelter with her family and neighbors. Her efforts and cheerfulness support those around her, but she also experiences sadness at the loss of her loved ones. In the midst of all this, Suzu tries to find hope for life while facing the harsh reality of war. Her drawings and imagination become her strength to overcome the painful reality, and she gradually looks to the future with her family and friends.

japanese: 味噌汁は日本の伝統的な食べ物です。味噌とだしで作ります。味噌は大豆から作られたペーストです。だしは魚や昆布を使って作ります。味噌汁には豆腐やわかめ、ねぎ、野菜などを入れます。具材は季節や地域で違います。作り方は簡単です。まず、水を沸かします。そして、だしを入れます。次に、味噌を少しずつ溶かします。最後に、好きな具材を入れて少し煮ます。味噌汁は朝ごはんや夕ごはんによく出ます。健康に良くて、美味しい食べ物です。毎日食べる人も多いです。
english: Miso soup is a traditional Japanese food. It is made with miso and dashi. Miso is a paste made from soybeans. Dashi is made from fish or kelp. Tofu, wakame seaweed, green onions, and vegetables are added to miso soup. Ingredients vary depending on the season and region. The recipe is simple. First, boil water. Then, add dashi (soup stock). Next, dissolve miso a little at a time. Finally, add the ingredients of your choice and simmer for a bit. Miso soup is often served for breakfast and dinner. It is a healthy and tasty food. Many people eat it every day.

japanese: お好み焼きは日本の有名な料理です。広島と大阪が特に有名なお好み焼きの場所です。お好み焼きは、小麦粉、水、卵、キャベツ、肉や海鮮などを使って作ります。材料を混ぜて、鉄板で焼きます。上にソース、マヨネーズ、青のり、かつお節をのせると、とてもおいしいです。広島のお好み焼きは、焼きそばやうどんを入れるのが特徴です。一方、大阪のお好み焼きは、材料を全部混ぜてから焼きます。それぞれの作り方に違いがありますが、どちらも人気があります。日本では、お好み焼きを自分で作ることができるレストランもあります。友達や家族と一緒に作って食べると楽しいです。もし日本に行く機会があれば、ぜひお好み焼きを食べてみてください！
english: Okonomiyaki is a famous Japanese dish. Hiroshima and Osaka are especially famous places for okonomiyaki. Okonomiyaki is made with flour, water, eggs, cabbage, and meat or seafood. The ingredients are mixed together and cooked on a griddle. Sauce, mayonnaise, aonori (green laver), and bonito flakes are added on top. Hiroshima okonomiyaki is characterized by the addition of yakisoba or udon noodles. On the other hand, Osaka okonomiyaki is made by mixing all the ingredients together before baking. Although there are differences in the way they are made, both are very popular. In Japan, some restaurants allow customers to make their own okonomiyaki. It is fun to make and eat it with friends and family. If you have a chance to visit Japan, please try okonomiyaki!

japanese: コスプレは日本の文化の一つとして、世界中で人気があります。コスプレは「コスチューム」と「プレイ」という言葉から来ています。アニメやマンガ、ゲームのキャラクターの衣装を着て、そのキャラクターになりきることを楽しむ趣味です。コスプレイベントは日本だけでなく、海外でも行われています。日本では特に東京の秋葉原や大阪の日本橋など、オタク文化が盛んな場所で多く見られます。イベントでは、コスプレイヤーたちが集まり、写真を撮ったり交流したりします。コスプレをするためには、衣装や小道具を作るスキルや、キャラクターへの深い理解が必要です。一部の人は手作りの衣装を作りますが、最近ではオンラインで購入することもできます。コスプレは創造性と自己表現の場として、多くの人に楽しまれています。この文化は、アニメやマンガの人気とともに、ますます広がっています。
english: Cosplay is a part of Japanese culture and is popular all over the world. Cosplay comes from the words “costume” and “play." It is a hobby in which people enjoy dressing up as characters from anime, manga, and video games and becoming those characters. Cosplay events are held not only in Japan but also in other countries. In Japan, they are especially common in places where otaku culture thrives, such as Akihabara in Tokyo and Nihonbashi in Osaka. At these events, cosplayers gather to take pictures and socialize. Cosplay requires skill in making costumes and props, as well as a deep understanding of the characters. Some people make their costumes by hand; these days you can even buy them online. Cosplay is enjoyed by many as an outlet for creativity and self-expression. This culture is growing along with the popularity of anime and manga.

japanese: 日光は日本の栃木県にある美しい観光地です。日光にはたくさんの有名な場所があります。たとえば、日光東照宮は世界遺産に登録されています。この神社は徳川家康を祀る神社で、とても華やかな建物が特徴です。また、日光には自然も豊かです。中禅寺湖や華厳の滝は、観光客に人気があります。中禅寺湖は美しい湖で、ボートに乗ったり、散歩したりできます。華厳の滝は高さ97メートルの大きな滝で、四季折々の景色が楽しめます。さらに、日光は温泉でも有名です。湯元温泉や鬼怒川温泉は、旅行者にリラックスできる場所として知られています。日光は歴史、自然、温泉が一度に楽しめる場所です。日本を訪れるなら、ぜひ日光にも行ってみてください！
english: Nikko is a beautiful tourist destination located in Tochigi Prefecture, Japan. Nikko has many famous places. For example, Nikko Toshogu Shrine is registered as a World Heritage Site. This shrine is dedicated to Tokugawa Ieyasu and features a very gorgeous building. Nikko is also rich in nature. Lake Chuzenji and Kegon Falls are popular among tourists. Lake Chuzenji is a beautiful lake where visitors can take a boat ride or a walk. Kegon Falls is a large 97-meter-high waterfall with seasonal views. Nikko is also famous for its hot springs. Yumoto Onsen and Kinugawa Onsen are well known as places for travelers to relax. Nikko is a place where you can enjoy history, nature, and hot springs all at once. If you are visiting Japan, Nikko is definitely worth a visit!

japanese: おせち料理は、日本のお正月に食べる伝統的な料理です。おせちは、お正月の間、台所で料理をしなくても良いように、事前に準備されます。また、それぞれの料理には特別な意味が込められています。例えば、黒豆は健康と長寿を象徴し、数の子は子孫繁栄を願うものです。おせち料理は重箱という四角い箱に詰められ、見た目も華やかです。一の重には祝い肴や甘い料理、二の重には焼き物、三の重には煮物が入るのが一般的です。地方や家庭によって内容が異なることも多く、それぞれの地域の特色が表れています。最近では、手作りではなく、スーパーやデパートで購入する人も増えています。また、伝統的なおせちだけでなく、洋風や中華風のおせちも人気があります。現代のライフスタイルに合わせて、おせちも少しずつ変化しているのです。おせちは家族や親しい人々と一緒に食べることが多く、新しい年を迎える喜びを分かち合う大切な時間を象徴しています。このように、おせち料理は日本の文化や伝統を深く知ることができる象徴的な存在です。
english: Osechi is traditional Japanese New Year's cuisine. Osechi is prepared in advance so that people do not have to cook in the kitchen during the New Year. Each dish also has a special meaning. For example, black soybeans symbolize health and longevity, and sukago (a number of offspring) is a wish for the prosperity of one's offspring. Osechi dishes are packed in a rectangular box called jyuubako, which looks gorgeous. Generally, the first layer contains festive snacks and sweet dishes, the second layer contains grilled dishes, and the third layer contains simmered dishes. The contents often vary from region to region and from household to household, showing the characteristics of each region. Recently, an increasing number of people buy their food at supermarkets and department stores instead of making it by hand. In addition to traditional osechi, Western and Chinese-style osechi are also popular. Osechi is gradually changing to suit modern lifestyles. Osechi is often eaten with family and close friends, symbolizing an important time to share the joy of welcoming the new year. In this way, Osechi cuisine is a symbolic way to learn more about Japanese culture and traditions.

japanese: 歌舞伎は、日本の伝統的な演劇であり、約400年の歴史があります。歌舞伎は江戸時代に始まり、最初は庶民の娯楽として発展しました。その特徴は、華やかな衣装、独特な化粧、そして大胆な動きにあります。歌舞伎の舞台は、「花道」という特別な通路を使って演技が行われることが多いです。この花道は観客席の中を通り、役者が劇的に登場したり退場したりするために使われます。また、「隈取」という顔の化粧も有名で、役柄や感情を強調するために使用されます。歌舞伎の演目は、歴史物や恋愛物、そして人間関係を描いたものが多いです。特に、「義理と人情」の対立がテーマとなることが多く、日本文化の価値観を反映しています。現在、歌舞伎はユネスコの無形文化遺産に登録され、国内外で高い評価を受けています。初めて見る人には、日本語が分からなくても楽しめるように、英語の字幕や解説が用意されることもあります。日本に訪れた際は、ぜひ一度歌舞伎を体験してみてください。
english: Kabuki is a traditional Japanese theater with a history of about 400 years. Kabuki began in the Edo period (1603-1867) and initially developed as entertainment for the common people. It is characterized by its flamboyant costumes, distinctive makeup, and daring movements. Kabuki performances often take place on a special passageway called hanamichi. This hanamichi passes through the audience and is used for the dramatic entrance and exit of actors. Another well-known use is “kumadori,” or facial makeup, which is used to emphasize roles and emotions. Many Kabuki plays are historical, romantic, and depict human relationships. In particular, the conflict between “righteousness and humanity” is often a theme, reflecting the values of Japanese culture. Kabuki is currently registered as a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage and is highly acclaimed both in Japan and abroad. For first-time viewers, English subtitles and commentary are sometimes provided so that they can enjoy the performance even if they do not understand Japanese. We encourage you to experience Kabuki once when you visit Japan.

japanese: お盆は日本の伝統的な行事で、先祖を供養するための特別な時期です。毎年8月中旬に行われることが多く、特に8月13日から15日が一般的です。この期間、人々は実家に帰り、先祖の霊を迎えたり送り出したりするための儀式を行います。お盆の間、多くの家庭では仏壇に供物を供えたり、提灯を飾ったりします。また、お墓参りに行き、先祖に感謝の気持ちを伝えるのも重要な行事です。地域によっては、迎え火や送り火といった独自の風習があります。これらの火は先祖の霊が迷わないように道を照らす役割を果たします。さらに、お盆踊りという伝統的な踊りも行われます。盆踊りは、地域のコミュニティで開催され、祭りのような雰囲気の中で行われることが多いです。踊りを通じて先祖とつながり、感謝を示すと同時に、地域の人々との交流を深める機会となります。お盆は、家族や先祖との絆を再確認する大切な行事であり、日本文化の重要な一部です。この時期、日本全国で特別な風習や行事が見られるため、外国人にとっても日本の伝統を知る良い機会と言えます。
english: Obon is a traditional Japanese event, a special time of year for making offerings to ancestors. It is usually held in mid-August each year, especially from August 13 to 15. During this period, people return to their parents' homes and hold ceremonies to welcome and send off the spirits of their ancestors. During Obon, many families place offerings on Buddhist altars and decorate lanterns. It is also important to visit graves and express gratitude to ancestors. Some regions have their own customs such as welcoming and sending off fires. These fires serve to light the way so that the spirits of ancestors do not get lost. In addition, a traditional dance called Bon Odori is also held. Bon dances are often held in local communities and take place in a festive atmosphere. It is an opportunity to connect with one's ancestors and show gratitude through dancing, as well as an opportunity to deepen one's relationship with others in the community. Obon is an important event that reaffirms the bonds with family and ancestors and is an important part of Japanese culture. Special customs and events can be found throughout Japan during this time of year, and it is a good opportunity for foreigners to learn about Japanese traditions.

japanese: 鈴木大拙は、日本を代表する仏教学者であり、禅の思想を世界に広めた人物として知られています。彼は1870年に石川県金沢市で生まれ、本名を鈴木貞太郎と言います。明治時代の日本で学問を追求し、特に仏教と西洋哲学に深い興味を持ちました。鈴木は東京帝国大学で学び、その後、浄土真宗の学僧・西田幾多郎や、禅僧・釈宗演の教えを受けました。1897年にはアメリカのイリノイ州に渡り、翻訳家として活動しながら仏教思想を研究しました。この時期に彼は英語で多くの仏教書を執筆し、特に禅についての解説を行いました。1921年に日本に帰国後、鈴木は大谷大学で教鞭を執りながら、禅と東洋思想に関する多くの著作を発表しました。彼の代表作『禅と日本文化』は、禅の本質とその日本文化への影響を分析した名著として広く知られています。また、彼は海外の学者や哲学者とも積極的に交流し、東西思想の架け橋として活躍しました。晩年には、世界中で講演を行い、禅の思想を国際的に広めることに努めました。1966年に96歳で亡くなるまで、鈴木の活動は多くの人々に影響を与え続けました。彼の業績は、今日でも日本文化と禅に関する研究において重要な位置を占めています。
english: D. T. Suzuki is one of Japan's leading Buddhist scholars and is known as the person who spread Zen philosophy throughout the world. He was born in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture in 1870 and his real name was Teitaro Suzuki. He pursued his academic studies in Japan during the Meiji era (1868-1912) and developed a deep interest in Buddhism and Western philosophy in particular. Suzuki studied at Tokyo Imperial University and later received teachings from Kitaro Nishida, a Jodo Shinshu scholar, and Zen monk Shaku Zong-en. In 1897, he moved to Illinois, U.S., where he worked as a translator and studied Buddhist thought. After returning to Japan in 1921, Suzuki taught at Otani University and published numerous works on Zen and Eastern thought. His best-known work, Zen and Japanese Culture, is widely known as a masterful analysis of the nature of Zen and its influence on Japanese culture. He also actively interacted with scholars and philosophers abroad, serving as a bridge between Eastern and Western thought. In his later years, Suzuki gave lectures around the world to promote Zen thought internationally, and until his death in 1966 at the age of 96, his activities continued to influence many people. His work remains an important part of the study of Japanese culture and Zen today.

japanese: 南京大虐殺（南京事件）は、1937年12月から1938年1月にかけて、日本軍が中国の南京を占領した際に発生した、大規模な暴力行為と戦争犯罪を指す。この事件では、多数の民間人および捕虜が殺害され、略奪や強姦といった非人道的行為が行われたとされている。南京は当時、中国国民政府の首都であり、その陥落は日中戦争（第二次上海事変以降の戦い）の中でも特に象徴的な出来事であった。しかし、南京を占領した日本軍の一部は規律を失い、民間人や非戦闘員に対して広範囲にわたる虐待を行ったとされる。具体的な被害者の数については諸説あり、中国側は30万人以上と主張している一方、日本の一部の研究者は数万人とする意見もある。このため、南京大虐殺を巡る議論は今なお歴史認識の問題として日中間で論争の的となっている。南京大虐殺は単なる戦時中の出来事としてではなく、戦争の悲劇と人間の残虐性を象徴する事例として語り継がれている。戦争の本質を学び、二度と同じ過ちを繰り返さないためにも、歴史的事実に基づいた正確な理解と冷静な議論が必要である。歴史は時に政治的意図によって歪められることがあるが、その中で真実を追求する姿勢こそが平和への第一歩であると言えるだろう。
english: The Nanjing Massacre (Nanking Incident) refers to the massive acts of violence and war crimes that occurred during the Japanese occupation of Nanking, China, from December 1937 to January 1938. The incident resulted in the murder of numerous civilians and prisoners of war, as well as inhumane acts of looting and rape. Nanking was the capital of the Chinese Nationalist government at the time, and its fall was one of the most symbolic events of the Sino-Japanese War (fought after the Second Shanghai Incident). However, it is believed that some of the Japanese troops who occupied Nanking lost discipline and committed widespread abuses against civilians and non-combatants. There are various theories as to the specific number of victims, with the Chinese claiming more than 300,000, while some Japanese researchers believe the number to be in the tens of thousands. As a result, the debate over the Nanjing Massacre remains a controversial issue of historical awareness between Japan and China. The Nanjing Massacre has been passed down not merely as a wartime event, but as a symbolic example of the tragedy of war and human cruelty. In order to learn the true nature of war and never repeat the same mistakes again, accurate understanding and dispassionate discussion based on historical facts are necessary. History can sometimes be distorted by political agendas, but the first step toward peace is to pursue the truth in this context.
